p: Until 2002, coronaviruses (HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43 and HKU) were first known to cause common cold in humans. However, in 2002 the SARS-CoV emerged, and then in 2013 the MERS-CoV. The SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV caused severe respiratory syndrome and were highly pathogenic for humans, because of their ability to adapt to their host, notably to increase affinity for their receptor, leading to high infectivity in humans ( 1, 2).
